benchmark_details.name: A document processing pipeline for the construction of a dataset for topic modeling based on the judgments of the Italian Supreme Court
benchmark_details.overview: We developed a document processing pipeline that generates an anonymized dataset of legal judgments optimized for topic modeling, addressing challenges such as limited datasets in the Italian legal domain.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To create a novel dataset from Italian Supreme Court judgments for the purpose of applying topic modeling and ensuring compliance with privacy regulations.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The anonymization module lacks systematic quantitative validation due to time constraints.

data.source: Italian Supreme Court published judgments, ordinances, and decrees available on the Italgiure website.
data.annotation: Manual annotation using Label Studio, following DocLayNet annotation scheme.

methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on the performance of various models used in the pipeline and topic modeling quality.
methodology.interpretation: Higher values indicate better performance in detection, recognition, and topic quality.
methodology.baseline_results: mAP@50 of 0.964 and mAP@50-95 of 0.800 for DLA; CER of 0.0047 and WER of 0.0248 for OCR; topic diversity of 0.6198 and coherence score of 0.663.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated through a detailed evaluation against expert interpretations and comparisons with previous methods.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Anonymization procedures were integrated to ensure compliance with GDPR guidelines.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: The pipeline aims to meet GDPR requirements for data anonymization.
